quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Game and Video
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, douglas, game. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: With the introduction of cheap and relatively powerful processors such as Intel 386, Intel 486 and Motorola 68000 3D-graphics became fashionable. It was used in FPS games like the legendary Wolfenstein 3D and Doom. Do you know what FPS stands for in this context?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: First Person Shooter

questions.question: Where is the Lucky 7s Machine located in the game Dogs Life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lake Minniwahwah Cafe

questions.question: In 1972 a company named Waco released the first handheld electronic game. What was its name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tic Tac Toe

questions.question: Pong was first installed at a high school.
What color is the jacket the girl wants you to get from the ski slopes in the video game Dogs Life?

In 1978 Taito released one of the most influential arcade video games. It was called Space Invaders and marked the beginning of the Golden Age of arcade games. What was the thing that the player controlled in Space Invaders?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A movable laser cannon

questions.question: Mario, probably the best-known video game character, first appeared in Donkey Kong in 1981.  His brother Luigi first appeared in Mario Bros.
In the Dogs Life video game, what does the girl NOT ask you to bring to make her snowman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a scarf

questions.question: What color is Miss Peaches hair in the video game Dogs Life?
In the Dogs Life video game, what is the name of the group of bandits at Boom City?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sleeping Bandits

questions.question: Nintendo is undoubtedly one of the most successful and best known console manufacturers. Nintendo has created several TV consoles and many handheld portables, such as the Game Boy and the Game  Watch. When was the company originally founded?

Nolan Bushnell is considered to be the father of the video arcade industry. In 1972 he founded his own game company and together with Ted Dabney and Al Alcorn released the first arcade video game with major success- Pong. What was the name of his company?
What button do you press to dig in Dogs Life (PS2)?
Greta Garbo was successfully treated for this disease.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Breast cancer

questions.question: In 1952, A.S. Douglas developed the first graphical game to run on a computer.  It ran on the EDSAC.  What was the name of this game?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Member and Superhero
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, marvel, mascot. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these X-Men characters is not a member of the Summers family line?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mister Sinister

questions.question: Fellow Justice League members Superman and Martian Manhunter have something in common. What is it?

options.text: They are both reporters by day
They both grew up on a farm.
They both escaped from the phantom zone.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are both aliens.

questions.question: Which fictional member ot the Teen Titans started out as Batmans sidekick?
Archangel, a mutant and a member of the X-Men, was which horseman of Apocalypse?
This superhero, who first appeared in the comic book Tales of Suspense, used his own invention to keep his heart pumping.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iron Man

questions.question: This comedic superhero, created by Ben Edlund, met an accountant named Arthur, after taking a long bus ride into The City.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Tick

questions.question: When in 1996 3dfx released the Voodoo chipset, it made high-resolution and more-detailed 3D games possible. One of the first games to take advantage of this was Quake. Do you know which company released this marvelous game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: id Software

questions.question: What is the real name of Gambit who first appeared in the comic book The Uncanny X-Men?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Remy LeBeau

questions.question: Which of the following fictional heroes is a World War II veteran?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Captain America

questions.question: This Marvel Comics superhero, whose birth name was Peter Benjamin Parker, first used his new found superpowers as a professional wrestler.
These comic book superheroes were trained in Professor Xaviers School for Gifted Youngsters.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The X-Men

questions.question: These fictional superheroes were born, when a container of radioactive waste bounced off a truck and struck a young boy, turning him into Daredevil.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

questions.question: This DC Comics superhero, whose true identity is Bruce Wayne, decided to train himself to the peak of physical perfection after witnessing the murder of his parents.
Sonic the Hedgehog is a mascot of Sony Playstation.
Which Marvel Comics character became a ruthless vigilante, after witnessing his familys violent murder?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Punisher

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Men and Miss America
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, abc, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: When was the Miss America pageant first held?
Who was the first Jewish Miss America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bess Myerson

questions.question: Omega Red, a foe of the X-Men, serves which country?
Until 2004 ABC aired the Miss America pageant , it then switched to what station?
Which antagonist of the X-Men is responsible for the death of Wolverine in the comic books?
The most common talents performed are singing and dancing, but there have been a variety of other odd talents as well.  Which talent was performed at a Miss America pageant?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Packing a suitcase

questions.question: Who is the head of the X-Men in the Age of Apocalypse timeline?
In what year did Snoopy first make his first appearance in a comic strip?
As of the beginning of the new millenium, how many Miss America title holders were from New Jersey, the state that held the competitions?
Which of these X-men characters is not a mutant?
What is the real name of X-Men member Wolverine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Howlett

questions.question: Who was the first deaf Miss America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heather Whitestone

questions.question: This member of the Hellfire Clubs inner circle, known as the White Queen, once fought against the X-Men.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emma Frost

questions.question: In the Age of Apocalypse timeline, Wolverine, a member of the X-Men, is married to which female?
Miss America always goes on to compete in the Miss Universe pageant.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Calvin and Character
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, roller, cartoon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Top Thrill Dragster was opened in 2003 and it was the tallest and fastest roller coaster in the world until 2005 (this is true). It was the first roller coaster to break the 300 ft (91.4 m) barrier.
What position did cartoon character Snoopy play in Charlie Browns Little League baseball team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Short Stop

questions.question: In what year did comic strip character Snoopy first appear sleeping on top of his doghouse?
Cartoon character Calvin hates taking baths.
Which one of these pairs roller coaster- theme park is wrong?

options.text: Superman - Ride of Steel- Six Flags Darien Lake

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Avalanche- Holiday World

questions.question: In what year did comic strip character Snoopy first walk upright?
What name was Charles Schulz originally going to give to Charlie Browns dog Snoopy?
October 2006 saw the release of which Mortal Kombat game?
What feature makes Kenshi different from all other Mortal Kombat characters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He is blind.

questions.question: How does Calvins dad like to spend his vacation in the comic strip Calvin and Hobbes
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Going Camping

questions.question: What does comic strip character Calvin like to do during recess?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: In the Mortal Kombat storyline, Liu Kang was brutally murdered by which character?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shang Tsung

questions.question: Which of these is NOT the name of one of the Calvin and Hobbes books?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Conclusive Calvin and Hobbes

questions.question: Which one of these pairs roller coaster- year of opening is wrong?
In the cartoon Calvin and Hobbes, Calvin enjoys the dinners that his mom makes.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Disney World and Title
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, shamu, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: There is more than one Killer Whale named Shamu in the SeaWorld parks in the U.S.
What SeaWorld attraction allows you to walk through a tube in which sharks swim all around you?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shark Encounter

questions.question: Which of these creatures is not featured in the exhibit of the world famous SeaWorld attraction Wild Arctic?
What is the title, given to employees at Disney World?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cast Members

questions.question: What are the names of the four theme parks that make up Disney World?

options.text: Magic Kingdom, Epcot, Animal Kingdom, Disney Hollywood Studios
Cedar Point, Holiday World, Magic Kingdom, Wilderness Park
Walt Disney World, Sea World, Busch Gardens, Circus World

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Magic Kingdom, Epcot, Animal Kingdom, Disney Hollywood Studios

questions.question: How many acres did Walt Disney purchase for Disney World to be built on?
Which of the following words is not part of the title of Calvins favorite book in the Calvin and Hobbes comic strip?
In what year did SeaWorld Orlando open?
Which of the following statements is a true fact about Disney World?

options.text: There is a tree farm on the Disney property, so that when a tree in one of the parks dies, it can be replaced by another mature tree.
The streets of Disney are steam cleaned every night after the parks close.
Gold leaf paint is used to paint the carousel horses.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of the above.

questions.question: What is the name of the SeaWorld Orlando amusement ride that is a combination of a water ride and a roller coaster?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Journey to Atlantis

questions.question: SeaWorld has an official airline and one of its Boeing 737 jetliners is painted to look like a flying Killer Whale. Name this airline.
What is the main icon of the Magic Kingdom park?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cinderellas Castle

questions.question: How many resorts are there on the Disney World property?
The Twilight Tower of Terror is a free fall thrill ride located in Hollywood Studios.  It is based on a television show from the 1950s.  What was the name of that show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Twilight Zone

questions.question: World Showcase is a part of Epcot that highlights different countries and cultures.  Which of the following countries is not in the Showcase?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Dilbert and Strip
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, following, edge. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which wrestler is famous for using a move called the Pedigree?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Triple H

questions.question: Which finishing move is most notably performed by Shawn Michaels?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sweet Chin Music

questions.question: What is the signature finishing move performed by EDGE of SmackDown?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Spear

questions.question: Dilbert from the self-titled comic strip is an engineer who graduated from MIT. What type of engineering degree does Dilbert have?
What is the name of Dilberts sometimes girlfriend in the comic strip Dilbert?
Which of the four parks is the largest single Disney theme park in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Animal Kingdom

questions.question: Who is the brother of the pointed-haired boss in the comic strip Dilbert?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phil, Prince of Insufficient Light

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the characters that live in Dilberts house in the comic strip Dilbert?
What is the name of Dilberts coworker in the comic strip Dilbert, who believes he has psychic powers?
Which WWE champion has two signature moves called the Swanton Bomb and the Twist of Fate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jeff Hardy

questions.question: Which of the following is not a word/term created by Scott Adams for the comic strip Dilbert?
What is the main icon of the Animal Kingdom park?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Tree of Life

questions.question: In the comic strip Dilbert, the real name of Dilberts pointed-haired boss is Phil.
Dave Animal Batistas famous ending move is called the Batista Drop.
The FU is the signature move of this wrestler, who also performs a pre-ending move called U Cant See Me.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Cena
